required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pilot Study to Compare ISOVUE®-250 and VISIPAQUE™ 270 for Motion Artifact and Pain in Peripheral DSA
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase IV Pilot Study to Compare ISOVUE®-250 and VISIPAQUE™ 270 for Motion Artifact and Pain in Peripheral Digital Subtraction Angiography (DSA)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare ISOVUE-250 and VISIPAQUE 270 for motion artifact and pain following intraarterial injection for peripheral DSA.

primary_outcome.measure: Level of Pain in the Lower Extremities Scored by the Participants on the Visual Analog Scale Following Intraarterial Administration of ISOVUE-250 or VISIPAQUE 270 in Peripheral DSA.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately prior to power injection run and again immediately following power injection run
primary_outcome.description: Visual Analog Scale: Patients were asked to mark on a 10 centimeter line where their pain was in the lower extremity of interest, in relation to the 2 extremes: no pain (0) on the far left and worst pain (10) on the far right. Pain Severity Scale: (0) None = VAS Score 0; (1) Mild = VAS Score 1-3; (2) Moderate = VAS Score 4-6; (3) Severe = VAS Score 7-10. Patients were assessed immediately prior to injection and again immediately following injection.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Number of Participants With Motion Artifacts Following Intraarterial Administration of ISOVUE-250 or VISIPAQUE 270 in Peripheral DSA.
secondary_outcome.description: Using the following 5-point scale, the Investigator reviewed the images for motion artifact in vessels distal to the knee: 0 = None; 1 = Mild, not significant; 2 = Significant, but correctable; 3 = Degrades image quality; 4 = Images uninterpretable.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Number of Participants Requiring Repeat Injection(s) Following Intraarterial Administration of ISOVUE-250 or VISIPAQUE 270 in Peripheral DSA.
secondary_outcome.description: The Investigator assessed the images and recorded the number of repeat power injections required due to motion artifacts for each participant.

intervention.description: VISIPAQUE 270 (Iodixanol Injection) is provided in bottles/flexible containers, ready to use sterile, pyrogen-free colorless to pale yellow solution
ISOVUE-250 (Iopamidol Injection) is provided in single dose bottles/vials, ready to use, aqueous, nonpyrogenic, colorless to pale yellow sterile solution

responsible_party.name_title: Carmela Houston/ Sr. Manager Corporate Clinical Research

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The first patient to participate in this study was dosed on September 17, 2008; the last patient on June 15, 2009.

group.title: ISOVUE 250
group.description: Participants were injected at least once in 1 of the following 3 locations: aortic bifurcation (injection rate 8-10 mL/s, total volume 15-20 mL), iliac arteries (injection rate 5-6 mL/s, total volume 10-12 mL), or superficial femoral artery (injection rate 3-5 mL/s, depending on diameter and condition of artery, total volume 8-12 mL to view only thigh, 10-15 mL to view calf as well, 20 mL for full runoff to foot).

group.title: VISIPAQUE 270
group.description: Participants were injected at least once in 1 of the following 3 locations: aortic bifurcation (injection rate 8-10 mL/s, total volume 15-20 mL), iliac arteries (injection rate 5-6 mL/s, total volume 10-12 mL), or superficial femoral artery (injection rate 3-5 mL/s, depending on diameter and condition of artery, total volume 8-12 mL to view only thigh, 10-15 mL to view calf as well, 20 mL for full runoff to foot).

group.title: ISOVUE 250
group.description: Participants were injected at least once in 1 of the following 3 locations: aortic bifurcation (injection rate 8-10 mL/s, total volume 15-20 mL), iliac arteries (injection rate 5-6 mL/s, total volume 10-12 mL), or superficial femoral artery (injection rate 3-5 mL/s, depending on diameter and condition of artery, total volume 8-12 mL to view only thigh, 10-15 mL to view calf as well, 20 mL for full runoff to foot).

group.title: VISIPAQUE 270
group.description: Participants were injected at least once in 1 of the following 3 locations: aortic bifurcation (injection rate 8-10 mL/s, total volume 15-20 mL), iliac arteries (injection rate 5-6 mL/s, total volume 10-12 mL), or superficial femoral artery (injection rate 3-5 mL/s, depending on diameter and condition of artery, total volume 8-12 mL to view only thigh, 10-15 mL to view calf as well, 20 mL for full runoff to foot).

outcome.title: Level of Pain in the Lower Extremities Scored by the Participants on the Visual Analog Scale Following Intraarterial Administration of ISOVUE-250 or VISIPAQUE 270 in Peripheral DSA.
outcome.description: Visual Analog Scale: Patients were asked to mark on a 10 centimeter line where their pain was in the lower extremity of interest, in relation to the 2 extremes: no pain (0) on the far left and worst pain (10) on the far right. Pain Severity Scale: (0) None = VAS Score 0; (1) Mild = VAS Score 1-3; (2) Moderate = VAS Score 4-6; (3) Severe = VAS Score 7-10. Patients were assessed immediately prior to injection and again immediately following injection.
outcome.time_frame: Immediately prior to power injection run and again immediately following power injection run
outcome.population: Patients who did not deviate from the planned protocol.

group.title: VAS Score Prior to Injection of ISOVUE 250
group.description: Pain Severity Scale: (0) None = VAS Score 0; (1) Mild = VAS Score 1-3; (2) Moderate = VAS Score 4-6; (3) Severe = VAS Score 7-10.

group.title: VAS Score After Injection of ISOVUE 250
group.description: Participants were injected at least once in 1 of the following 3 locations: aortic bifurcation (injection rate 8-10 mL/s, total volume 15-20 mL), iliac arteries (injection rate 5-6 mL/s, total volume 10-12 mL), or superficial femoral artery (injection rate 3-5 mL/s, depending on diameter and condition of artery, total volume 8-12 mL to view only thigh, 10-15 mL to view calf as well, 20 mL for full runoff to foot).

group.title: VAS Score Prior to Injection of VISIPAQUE 270
group.description: Pain Severity Scale: (0) None = VAS Score 0; (1) Mild = VAS Score 1-3; (2) Moderate = VAS Score 4-6; (3) Severe = VAS Score 7-10.

group.title: VAS Score After Injection of VISIPAQUE 270
group.description: Participants were injected at least once in 1 of the following 3 locations: aortic bifurcation (injection rate 8-10 mL/s, total volume 15-20 mL), iliac arteries (injection rate 5-6 mL/s, total volume 10-12 mL), or superficial femoral artery (injection rate 3-5 mL/s, depending on diameter and condition of artery, total volume 8-12 mL to view only thigh, 10-15 mL to view calf as well, 20 mL for full runoff to foot).

measure.title: Level of Pain in the Lower Extremities Scored by the Participants on the Visual Analog Scale Following Intraarterial Administration of ISOVUE-250 or VISIPAQUE 270 in Peripheral DSA.
measure.description: Visual Analog Scale: Patients were asked to mark on a 10 centimeter line where their pain was in the lower extremity of interest, in relation to the 2 extremes: no pain (0) on the far left and worst pain (10) on the far right. Pain Severity Scale: (0) None = VAS Score 0; (1) Mild = VAS Score 1-3; (2) Moderate = VAS Score 4-6; (3) Severe = VAS Score 7-10. Patients were assessed immediately prior to injection and again immediately following injection.
measure.population: Patients who did not deviate from the planned protocol.

analysis.groups_desc: Paired t-test to compare difference between the investigational product's mean change from predose to postdose

outcome.title: The Number of Participants With Motion Artifacts Following Intraarterial Administration of ISOVUE-250 or VISIPAQUE 270 in Peripheral DSA.
outcome.description: Using the following 5-point scale, the Investigator reviewed the images for motion artifact in vessels distal to the knee: 0 = None; 1 = Mild, not significant; 2 = Significant, but correctable; 3 = Degrades image quality; 4 = Images uninterpretable.
outcome.population: Patients who did not deviate from the planned protocol.

group.title: ISOVUE 250
group.description: Participants were injected at least once in 1 of the following 3 locations: aortic bifurcation (injection rate 8-10 mL/s, total volume 15-20 mL), iliac arteries (injection rate 5-6 mL/s, total volume 10-12 mL), or superficial femoral artery (injection rate 3-5 mL/s, depending on diameter and condition of artery, total volume 8-12 mL to view only thigh, 10-15 mL to view calf as well, 20 mL for full runoff to foot).

group.title: VISIPAQUE 270
group.description: Participants were injected at least once in 1 of the following 3 locations: aortic bifurcation (injection rate 8-10 mL/s, total volume 15-20 mL), iliac arteries (injection rate 5-6 mL/s, total volume 10-12 mL), or superficial femoral artery (injection rate 3-5 mL/s, depending on diameter and condition of artery, total volume 8-12 mL to view only thigh, 10-15 mL to view calf as well, 20 mL for full runoff to foot).

measure.title: The Number of Participants With Motion Artifacts Following Intraarterial Administration of ISOVUE-250 or VISIPAQUE 270 in Peripheral DSA.
measure.description: Using the following 5-point scale, the Investigator reviewed the images for motion artifact in vessels distal to the knee: 0 = None; 1 = Mild, not significant; 2 = Significant, but correctable; 3 = Degrades image quality; 4 = Images uninterpretable.
measure.population: Patients who did not deviate from the planned protocol.

analysis.groups_desc: Paired t-test to compare the difference in percentage between the portions of patients who had motion artifacts.

outcome.title: The Number of Participants Requiring Repeat Injection(s) Following Intraarterial Administration of ISOVUE-250 or VISIPAQUE 270 in Peripheral DSA.
outcome.description: The Investigator assessed the images and recorded the number of repeat power injections required due to motion artifacts for each participant.

group.title: ISOVUE 250
group.description: Participants were injected at least once in 1 of the following 3 locations: aortic bifurcation (injection rate 8-10 mL/s, total volume 15-20 mL), iliac arteries (injection rate 5-6 mL/s, total volume 10-12 mL), or superficial femoral artery (injection rate 3-5 mL/s, depending on diameter and condition of artery, total volume 8-12 mL to view only thigh, 10-15 mL to view calf as well, 20 mL for full runoff to foot).

measure.title: The Number of Participants Requiring Repeat Injection(s) Following Intraarterial Administration of ISOVUE-250 or VISIPAQUE 270 in Peripheral DSA.
measure.description: The Investigator assessed the images and recorded the number of repeat power injections required due to motion artifacts for each participant.

analysis.groups_desc: Paired t-test to compare difference in percentage between the number of participants requiring repeat injections

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The results of the study may be presented during scientific symposia or published in a scientific journal only after review by Bracco in accordance with the guidelines set forth in the applicable publication or financial agreement.
